intro: Vaccinium corymbosum var. amoenum, commonly known as the lowbush blueberry, is a variant of the lowbush blueberry species native to North America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trailing or ascending stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, which develop into the characteristic blue-black berries. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are commonly used in culinary applications. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and bogs.
